The House of Representatives US approved funding Iraq and Afghanistan and this is about $50 billion!
 These countries became new Vietnam for US. They are utter nightmare! These countries resemble black holes. They shark heaps of money and lots of American lives. How many accusations are we hearing out because of them?
 But how can American people stand that hundreds thousands $ of honest taxpayers and a quantity of American guys are devoured by that black holes? The community and mass media keep silence. This subject is a taboo. Everyone fears greatly to talk about it. Then can you tell me the difference between USA and those totalitarian countries she struggles with?

i am glad you are courageous enough to talk about black holes. and your concerns are dead on.
 
 we need more people with that kind of braverly to speak out against the authoritarian regimes that currently reigns.
 they are quietly picking up thousands upon thousands of civilians and sending them to gulags, which we all know are worse than even the concentration camps of the nazi.
 not only the police but also the feds are starting to wear black clothes and long black coats. sure their fedoras maybe fashionable but the fact that they pound our doors down at 3am and wisk away our roomates never to be seen again is alarming, especially at the rate people like michael moore are disappearing would frighten any citizen into silence. i fear Paris Hilton will be next.
 i see many truck loads of wide eyed people huddled on the back of military trucks being driven toward land fills and after the rat tat tat of machine gun fires, the land fills are mysteriously paved over with "Verboten" signs at the driveways.
 Our press like the venerable NYT are being silenced and can no longer publish any articles without mentioning Bush as "Dear Leader" or "Beloved Cowboy". And did you notice how they have outed "Deep Throat"? Clearly they have kowtow the WP into this. Sure there maybe a book deal in the works but because all the publication companies, newspaper and books, now take their cues from "Homeland Security" aka Big Brother, ala the MAN (The Great Cowboy) the dirty fingers of our own home grown authoritarian regime is obvious. they will try to silence the blogs next that i asure you and then where will we go when the Democratic Underground site is shut down?
 and most frightening is how Congress just rubber stamp the administration's proclaimations without a word of debate. Isn't it obvious to all that this is "How a Democracy die?"
 
 you are brave so brave to rise above the fear. you are a true hero and the real patriot.
 when the large men in black come for you, know that we are all with you in spirit. when they torture with stripping female interrogators and humiliate you by flushing down the toilet your unsoiled Playboy August issue for speaking out, please do not mention this post that have supported you and still support your esprit. sure the fundamentalist government monitors our posts but i've scrambled my electronic signature to minimize the chance of them tracing me.
 When will this madness end?

Someone needs to poll Americans about how they would feel if the US continues with its current level of over involvement through 2008 and the end of the Bush administration? That is realistically what will happen with our non leadership on Iraq reconstruction. I think most Americans would feel disgusted with this administration with the prospect of on going substantial loss of lives and money. 
 
 How do we disengage? A significant concession is needed for the Sunnis Muslims. This would not be easy, but it might eliminate a major source to terrorism. The Sunnis feel left out of the process of forming a new government. The Sunni leadership that is currently negotiating with the government to participate does not speak for all Sunnis. The insurgency has continued through their negotiations with no decrease. 
 
 A Sunnis country would provide two major advantages for our war on terrorism. Without Sunnis participation, troops can focus on securing Iraq borders. The real 9/11 type terrorists are the ones coming across the border from Saudi Arabia and Syria. Establishing a Sunnis country would once again establish a front line. If they continue terrorism against the Shi'ite Muslims and Kurds, we know their home address. A front line eliminates ambush as a tactic and establishes a conventional war. Saddam was seriously outmatched twice in this type of warfare, and a third time would be no different. 
 
 Unfortunately, finding alternatives to muddling through to 2008 may not be possible as long as the Bushit desk warriors are in charge. The military leadership needs to be in charge, as they have strenuously argued for years that they never again want to be put into another Vietnam situation. Desk warriors have taken over again as troops get killed in the role of Iraqi police, all for political goals. This is precisely what the career military people never wanted to see again and why the real military leaders have stressed quick deployment, highly mobile campaigns with no prolonged quagmire type involvements. Franks and Swartzkoph gave us two examples of what can be done in this manner, and it is what the military needs to stick to.
